newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $72 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $72 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was very slow, with not enough slaughter steer or heifer sales confirmed for a market test, USDA said. Inquiry and demand moderate.
Sales confirmed on 200 slaughter steers and 300 slaughter heifers Tuesday.
For the week to date 3,300 head confirmed including 1,600 head previously contracted or formulated cattle.
Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter steers - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1200 lbs 72.00. Slaughter heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 950-1200 lbs with end of heiferettes 71.00.
Wk to date - 3,300 last week - 63,100 last year - 13,300
